173.article_body: A "biscuit" contains the codes, known as Gold Codes, by which the US President can identify himself and authorise the use of nuclear weapons. A biscuit is about the size of a credit card. Recently, US President Joe Biden said the risk of nuclear 'Armageddon' is at the highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.

174.title: 21-yr-old man killed over using public toilet in Delhi, 2 brothers held
174.article_body: A 21-year-old man was killed following an argument with two brothers over using a public toilet in Delhi's Ashok Vihar area, police said. The accused have been arrested, police added. "The victim was previously involved in criminal cases...had threatened the two brothers with a surgical blade, after which they thrashed him...caused injuries to his head and chest," police stated.

175.title: Delhi records 97 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death in 24 hours
175.article_body: Delhi reported 97 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.41% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Tuesday. One death due to the infection was also recorded in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 420, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally has climbed to 20,04,284.

176.title: TN Guv speaking like 'RSS man': DMK on 'Dravidian identity' remark
176.article_body: The DMK said that the Tamil Nadu governor RN Ravi spoke like an 'RSS man' after he said that the concept of Dravidian has become Tamil identity due to politics of division. AIADMK echoed the Governor's sentiments and said that Dravidian geographically includes five states in southern India. "The Governor's remark does not merit attention", a senior DMK leader said.

177.title: Maharashtra logs 384 COVID-19 cases, four deaths in 24 hours
177.article_body: Maharashtra recorded 384 new cases of COVID-19 along with four deaths due to the infection in the last 24 hours, the state health department informed on Tuesday. Satara, Hingoli and Bhandara districts and Pune city logged one fatality each. Out of the fresh cases, 129 were reported from the state capital, Mumbai. Maharashtra's active case count stood at 2,387.

178.title: Railways plans to replace fuel-based vehicles with electric vehicles by 2025
178.article_body: As Centre plans to make India a 100% electric vehicle nation by 2030, the railways have floated a policy to replace its fuel-based vehicles, including those running on diesel, biofuels or natural gas, with electric vehicles by December 2025. A vast charging infrastructure would also be set up at major railway stations, office buildings and parking lots under the policy.

179.title: Want more compensation for Bhopal gas tragedy victims: Govt to SC
179.article_body: The Centre has told the Supreme Court that it wants to pursue a curative petition to provide additional compensation to victims of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy. As per the petition, the Centre is seeking â‚¹7,400 crore as an additional fund from successors of US-based Union Carbide. The Supreme Court posted the matter for hearing on January 10, 2023.

180.title: NATO to hold nuclear exercises next week despite Russian threats
180.article_body: Secretary-General of NATO Jens Stoltenberg on Tuesday said the military alliance will carry on with its nuclear exercises, dubbed "Steadfast Noon", next week, despite threats from Russian President Vladimir Putin. The exercise is held annually and goes on for about a week. The exercise involves fighter jets which can carry nuclear warheads, however, no live bombs are involved.

181.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan booked for receiving 'prohibited funds'
181.article_body: Ousted Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has been booked by the country's Federal Investigation Agency for allegedly receiving prohibited foreign funds. According to the FIR, the owner of Wooton Cricket Limited transferred "ill-gotten" funds to a bank account under Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf. The party leaders are accused of violating the Foreign Exchange Act.

182.title: RBI modifies guidelines to manage forex exposure during volatility
182.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) modified guidelines for banks to manage foreign currency exposure in times of forex volatility. The RBI said that banks have to provide a 25 percentage point increase in risk weight, if potential exposure from an entity's unhedged foreign currency exposure is over 75%. The RBI asked banks to ascertain the exposure annually at least.

183.title: Will try to win remaining races: Verstappen after winning world title
183.article_body: 2022 F1 world champion Max Verstappen said he will "definitely try" to win the remaining four races of the season. "There is no real pressure anymore but I still want to of course try and win more," said Verstappen. He added that he wanted to extend the current advantage as it may not be there "in the years to come".

184.title: Scientists discover new function of human brain's cerebellum
184.article_body: The primary function of the human brain's cerebellum is the regulation of movement. But scientists have recently discovered that the cerebellum also plays an important role in remembering emotional experiences. In the study that involved 1,418 participants, researchers found that the cerebellum showed an increase in brain activity of the participants while remembering positive and negative images.

185.title: Govt may give IDBI buyer free hand in running bank: Report
185.article_body: The government may offer the potential buyer, in the share purchase agreement of IDBI Bank, a free hand in running the bank. A government official said that they don't want to be a hindrance in the bank's functioning after the management control is passed to the buyer. The Centre and LIC are divesting 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank.

186.title: Mbappe seeking Jan transfer after feeling 'betrayed' by PSG: Report
186.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe is reportedly unhappy with the club and is looking for a transfer during the January window. Mbappe is said to be feeling "betrayed" as promises like a second striker alongside him and a new centre-back have not been fulfilled by the club. The forward's relationship with fellow striker Neymar is also said to be an issue.

187.title: If not reformed, UNSC will become irrelevant: S Jaishankar
187.article_body: The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) will become "irrelevant" if it is not reformed, said External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday. India has long demanded the Security Council be reformed and has also demanded a permanent seat in the UNSC. "Well, it's a hard nut but hard nuts can be cracked," said Jaishankar when asked about reforming the UNSC.

188.title: CCI directs 8 firms to cease and desist from unfair business practices
188.article_body: The Competition Commission of India directed eight firms and some of their officials to cease and desist from unfair business practices. CCI alleged the firms quoted identical bids in the tender floated for axle bearings which are used for certain railway coaches. The entities include Krishna Engineering Works, Chandra Brothers, Rama Engineering Works and Sriguru Melters & Engineers, among others.

189.title: India players dance to 'Bolo Ta Ra Ra' in dressing room after win, Dhawan shares video
189.article_body: Team India players danced to Daler Mehndi's song 'Bolo Ta Ra Ra' after winning the three-match ODI series against South Africa on Tuesday. Sharing the video, Shikhar Dhawan, who led the team in the series, wrote, "Jeet ke bolo Tara ra ra." Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "POV: When Shikhar bhai is captain."

190.title: FA to employ lip reader for Henderson-Gabriel altercation probe: Report
190.article_body: The Football Association (FA) is reportedly set to employ a lip reader as part of their ongoing investigation into the altercation between Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson and Arsenal defender Gabriel. The incident took place when the two teams played against each other and a penalty was awarded to Arsenal. The FA started its investigation based on referee Michael Oliver's report.

191.title: Goa to face loss of â‚¹500 cr if visa curbs to UK not relaxed: GFP MLA
191.article_body: Goa Forward Party (GFP) President and MLA Vijai Sardesai has claimed that Goa will face a loss of â‚¹500 crore if tourists from the UK don't visit the state due to visa restrictions. He appealed to the BJP government to relax the restrictions. Sardesai claimed a minimum of 40,000-50,000 tourists, who spend â‚¹98,000 each, visit Goa from the UK annually.

192.title: Mahakal Corridor scheme formed under Kamal Nath: Congress
192.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Congress has alleged that the scheme for the development and extension of Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple was prepared under the rule of Kamal Nath in 2019. State Home Minister Narottam Mishra has denied these claims and said that Kamal Nath 'has a habit of lying'. Mishra added that the proposal for the scheme was prepared in 2017.

193.title: 44 Syrian migrants found inside truck in North Macedonia
193.article_body: Police in North Macedonia have detained 44 Syrian migrants, including 14 minors, who were discovered hiding inside a truck near the southern border with Greece, authorities said on Tuesday. The truck driver was arrested on suspicion of having links with a migrant-smuggling ring. The migrants were found inside a specially-constructed hiding place within the truck, as per local authorities.

194.title: DoT, MeitY to hold meeting with smartphone firms, telcos to resolve 5G issues
194.article_body: Top officials of the Department of Telecom (DoT) and IT ministry have called a joint meeting of smartphone companies, including Apple and Samsung, and telecom operators to ensure smooth rollout of 5G, including smooth onboarding of customers. The meeting will be held on Wednesday at the DoT office. Secretaries of both the DoT and IT ministry will chair the meeting.

195.title: 'Sign of weakness': NATO chief on Russian strikes across Ukraine
195.article_body: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg on Tuesday said he believes that Russia's missile strikes on Ukrainian cities on Monday were a "sign of weakness" as Russian forces are unable "to make progress on the battlefield". "While Russia is increasingly resorting to horrific and indiscriminate attacks on civilians and critical infrastructure, President Putin is failing in Ukraine," Stoltenberg stated.

196.title: Condemn Russia's irresponsible nuclear rhetoric: G7 leaders at meet
196.article_body: The leaders of the Group of Seven (G7) nations have condemned Russia's "irresponsible nuclear rhetoric" and recent missile strikes on Ukraine. The leaders said the use of nuclear, chemical or biological weapons would invite "severe consequences". The G7 leaders on Tuesday held an emergency virtual meeting, which was attended by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

197.title: Suzlon Group gets 144.9 MW wind power order from Aditya Birla Group
197.article_body: Suzlon Group announced that it has secured an order for the development of 144.9 MW of wind power projects for Aditya Birla Group. Suzlon will install 69 units of wind turbine generators (wind turbines) with a Hybrid Lattice Tubular (HLT) tower and a rated capacity of 2.1 MW each. The project is located at sites in Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh.

198.title: Govt mulls 233 GW new transmission capacity for renewable energy
198.article_body: The Ministry of Power said the government is mulling electricity transmission for renewable energy capacity of about 233 GW, latest by 2030, across the country. The ministry told members of Parliamentary Consultative Committee, "Planning of transmission system for integration of additional 52 GW potential REZ (renewable energy zone) by 2026-27 have been carried out."

199.title: More than 1,300 fans banned from FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar by UK
199.article_body: More than 1,300 fans from England and Wales with banning orders won't be allowed to travel to Qatar for FIFA World Cup 2022, the UK's Home Office said. "We will not let the behaviour of a minority of lawbreakers tarnish what will be an exciting tournament," said Home Secretary Suella Braverman. The banned supporters have a history of soccer-related violence.

200.title: Lakshya Sen moves to career-best No. 8 in world badminton rankings
200.article_body: Commonwealth Games champion Lakshya Sen moved up to his career-best eighth position in the Badminton World Federation (BWF) men's singles rankings. The 21-year-old Sen was previously ranked at ninth position. Notably, the Almora-born shuttler started the year with a gold medal at the Yonex-Sunrise India Open 2022 and was also a runner-up at the All England Open Badminton Championships.

201.title: Voting for Congress is voting for BJP: Sisodia to Himachal voters
201.article_body: Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Manish Sisodia on Tuesday told voters in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh that "voting for the Congress is equal to voting for the BJP". Legislators from Congress will join the BJP after the elections, claimed Sisodia. His comments came after BJP National President JP Nadda's speech earlier in the day in the state.

202.title: Digvijaya Singh asks Lalu Prasad Yadav to join Bharat Jodo Yatra
202.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has asked RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav to join the ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra as it will "send out a good message". Speaking at the RJD's national convention, Lalu asked all parties, including Congress, to come together against the BJP in the 2024 elections. He added that an Emergency-like dictatorial atmosphere prevails in India.

203.title: Ex-India head coach Kirsten joins Netherlands as consultant for T20 WC
203.article_body: Former India head coach Gary Kirsten has joined the Netherlands team as a consultant for the T20 World Cup. The team have also roped in Australian all-rounder Dan Christian into their backroom staff. Kirsten had worked with the team during their Super League series against Ireland last year and the team trained at Kirsten's Cape Town academy in September.

204.title: Govt ensured balanced, equitable development of every region: Himachal CM
204.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday said the BJP government ensured balanced and equitable development of every region of the state in the last five years. Thakur inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for 183 developmental projects worth â‚¹1,008.42 crore from Kullu for various Assembly constituencies. For Kangra district, he inaugurated 28 developmental projects worth â‚¹108.98 crore.

205.title: US has been participating de facto in Ukraine war: Russian Foreign Minister
205.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Tuesday told state television that the Ukraine war was being "controlled by the Anglo-Saxons". "It seems to me that the Americans have been participating de facto in this war for a long time," said Lavrov. He also refuted White House national security spokesman John Kirby's claim that Russia had refused talks with the US.

206.title: Took us time to get used to conditions: Boucher on SA's series loss vs India
206.article_body: South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said some "soft dismissals" put his team under pressure in their seven-wicket loss against India in the third ODI in New Delhi. "It took us time to get used to conditions...India bowled really well with intent and aggression. We take from here some good lessons," he added. South Africa lost the three-match series 1-2.

207.title: BJP to contest all 60 seats in 2023 Meghalaya Assembly elections
207.article_body: The BJP has announced to field candidates in all the 60 seats in Meghalaya Assembly election, which is expected to be held in February 2023. Meghalaya BJP President Ernest Mawrie said people of the state are happy with the schemes implemented by the BJP-led central government. The BJP is an ally of the National People's Party-led coalition government in Meghalaya.

208.title: 17-yr-old boy arrested for 'marrying' 16-yr-old girl in Tamil Nadu
208.article_body: A 17-year-old boy has been arrested by Tamil Nadu Police in Cuddalore after a video of him 'marrying' a 16-year-old minor girl at a bus shelter went viral. The man who recorded the video of the public incident was also arrested by the police. The girl received counselling while the boy has been sent to a juvenile home.

209.title: 2 killed in explosion at illegal firecracker unit in West Bengal
209.article_body: Two persons including a teenage boy were killed and five others injured after an explosion at an illegal firecracker unit in West Bengal's East Midnapore. The owner of the house where the explosion took place had his firecracker manufacturing license lapse last year. A portion of the house's roof collapsed after the explosion in the room being used for storage.

210.title: Indian Railways' earning increases 92% YoY to â‚¹33,476 cr in FY23 till October
210.article_body: Indian Railways said that its total approximate earnings from April 1 to October 8, 2022, is â‚¹33,476 crore, registering a 92% increase on a year-on-year basis. In reserved passenger segment, the total approximate number of passengers booked during the period increased from 34.56 crore to 42.89 crore. Railways reported a revenue of â‚¹26,961 crore from reserved passenger segment.

211.title: I have spoken to Putin only once and that was about 18 months ago: Musk
211.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "I have spoken to Putin only once and that was about 18 months ago." He added, "The subject matter was space." Musk's tweet came after reports claimed that he directly spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin before tweeting a proposal to end the war in Ukraine earlier this month.

212.title: Sourav Ganguly declines IPL Chairman post, to be out of BCCI: Report
212.article_body: Sourav Ganguly's tenure as BCCI President will come to an end next week when Roger Binny will replace him at the annual general meeting, the Indian Express reported. Ganguly was offered the post of IPL Chairman, however, he declined the offer, the report added. The BCCI won't back Ganguly for the post of ICC Chairman as well, the report stated.

213.title: Was told to fight Cong polls 18 hrs before filing nomination: Kharge
213.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that he was told to contest for the post of the party's President 18 hours before he filed his nomination papers. "I am of the belief that the party needs Rahul Gandhi and his leadership," he added. Kharge said that Rahul Gandhi didn't want any Gandhi family member to be the Congress President.

214.title: Complete lie: Cong on claim of 'using' kids during Bharat Jodo Yatra
214.article_body: Congress dismissed child rights body NCPCR's allegation that the party violated the law by setting up 'Jawahar Bal Manch' and "using" children for political purposes during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. NCPCR has lodged an official complaint with the Election Commission of India. Congress leader Jairam Ramesh called the allegation a "complete lie". Several children have been spotted at the yatra.

215.title: 34,000 people affected due to floods in 3 districts of Assam
215.article_body: Nearly 34,000 people, including 8,378 children, from three districts of Assam, namely Dhemaji, Lakhimpur and Dibrugarh, have been affected by floods. According to Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA), the water level of the Brahmaputra river is flowing above the danger level mark at Neamatighat in Jorhat. The flood waters have submerged 1,300 hectares of cropland in these districts.

216.title: New space bill completely different from the 2017 bill: ISpA
216.article_body: Director General of the Indian Space Association (ISpA) Lt Gen AK Bhatt said the new space bill is "completely different" from the bill proposed in 2017. According to the 2017 bill, any activity undertaken without prior licensing would attract a jail term. "That (previous bill) was a little harsh," Lt Gen Bhatt said.

217.title: Hrithik Shokeen creates history, becomes first-ever 'Impact Player' in Indian T20 cricket
217.article_body: Delhi off-spinner Hrithik Shokeen has created history by becoming the first-ever 'Impact Player' in Indian T20 cricket. The 22-year-old became the first tactical substitute under new rules after he replaced opener Hiten Dalal, who scored 47(27) in Delhi's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match on Tuesday. Shokeen registered figures of 3-0-13-2 as Delhi won by 71 runs.

218.title: Hosts India open their FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup campaign with 0-8 defeat against USA
218.article_body: Hosts India opened their FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup campaign with a 0-8 defeat against USA in a Group A match in Bhubaneswar. It is USA's biggest-ever victory in the history of FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup. USA scored five goals in the first half and the remaining three goals in the second half.

219.title: Video shows Rahul doing pushups on the road during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K'taka
219.article_body: Congress on Tuesday shared a video of Rahul Gandhi doing pushups on a road in Karnataka during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. Rahul was joined by Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar and the party's General Secretary KC Venugopal in taking the 'pushup challenge'. The party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which began on September 7, will conclude in Kashmir.

220.title: Kangana meets Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, shares pics
220.article_body: Kangana Ranaut met Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur in Manali on Tuesday. She took to Instagram to share a series of pictures from the meeting. In a picture, Kangana was seen having breakfast with Thakur and others. "Mom specially made Himachali bhalles and babrus as breakfast for our CM, which he ate and really loved," she captioned the picture.

221.title: BJP alleges Congress leader among Maoists arrested in Chhattisgarh
221.article_body: The BJP's Chhattisgarh unit has alleged that a Congress leader from Bastar's Bijapur district was arrested by the Telangana Police along with four Maoists. "Satyam, who is a block Congress president, was also arrested by police. Satyam was close to a local Congress MLA," alleged former Forest Minister Mahesh Gagda. The Congress has denied Satyam's links to the party.

222.title: Honda Motor, LG to build $4.4 billion EV battery plant in US' Ohio
222.article_body: Honda Motor and LG Energy Solution on Tuesday said that they will build a new joint venture $4.4 billion plant to produce batteries for electric vehicles in US' Ohio. The companies had announced the plans for this last year, but had not revealed a location. The companies are planning to begin the construction of the new plant in early 2023.

223.title: J&K administration approves sale of beer in departmental stores
223.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir (J-K) administration has approved the sale of beer at departmental stores in urban centres. The decision was taken in a meeting of the J-K Administrative Council (AC), chaired by Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha. Accordingly, changes have been made to the Jammu and Kashmir Liquor Licence and Sale Rules, 1984 and Excise Policy, 2023-24.

224.title: Give details of criminal cases on MPs/MLAs: Supreme Court to HCs
224.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has asked High Courts in the country to furnish details on criminal cases against lawmakers with a pendency of over five years. Justices Hima Kohli and DY Chandrachud said related affidavits must be filed in four weeks. The bench was hearing a PIL which sought a ban on convicted lawmakers from taking part in elections.

225.title: 1st solar observatory to solve mystery of Sunâ€™s eruptions launched by China
225.article_body: China launched the Advanced Space-based Solar Observatory (ASO-S), nicknamed Kuafu-1, its first solar observatory on October 9. Kuafu-1 aims to unravel the mysteries of the Sun's eruptions. It will provide insights into how the Sun's magnetic field causes coronal mass ejections (CMEs) and other eruptions. It will also conduct simultaneous observations of both solar flares and CMEs.

226.title: Raj student arrested over false allegations of rape threats by classmate
226.article_body: An 18-year-old student in Rajasthan's Jodhpur was arrested and expelled from his school after his classmate falsely accused him of threatening her with rape and acid attack as he had become friends with another girl. Police grew suspicious after she continued to complain of threat letters even after the boy's arrest. She later confessed she had written the letters herself.

227.title: Finance Minister Sitharaman reaches US for IMF-World Bank meet
227.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reached Washington DC on Tuesday to attend the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank. She will meet US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen. Sitharaman is also likely to participate in bilateral meetings with several countries, including Japan, South Korea, Saudi Arabia, Australia, Bhutan and New Zealand.

228.title: Iran intensifies crackdown on protesters in its Kurdistan province
228.article_body: Iran on Tuesday intensified its crackdown on protesters in the country's western Kurdistan province, with reports of police firing in Sanandaj city. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police over an "improper hijab". The US and Amnesty International have criticised the violence against demonstrators.

229.title: Lack of all-rounders has been issue for India: Ex-England skipper
229.article_body: Former English skipper Nasser Hussain said that not having enough all-rounders has been an issue for the Indian cricket team. "At the start of T20...everyone talked about how there is no need to worry about No.7," Hussain said. He added, "But actually, if you have a solid No.7, then it means that your top six can absolutely go for it."

230.title: 12-yr-old sets himself on fire over reluctance to return to school
230.article_body: A 12-year-old boarding school student allegedly attempted self-immolation in Odisha's Jajpur district on Tuesday after his parents refused to let him extend his stay at home following Durga Puja holidays, police informed. The boy sustained severe burn injuries and is currently battling for his life, police added. The police said they were looking into the matter.

231.title: Demands for reservation rise in K'taka after SC/ST quota hike
231.article_body: After the Karnataka government increased the quota for SCs and STs, reservation-related demands from other communities have increased in the state. Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that while there are aspirations from all communities, decisions will only be taken after due consideration. "Naturally, everyone will have aspirations. We have taken up SC/ST communities first," Bommai said.

232.title: First look of Adam Driver as Enzo Ferrari in Michael Mann's 'Ferrari' out
232.article_body: The first look of Adam Driver as Italian motor racing driver and entrepreneur Enzo Ferrari for the upcoming biopic 'Ferrari' has been revealed. The Michael Mann directorial will also feature Shailene Woodley and PenÃ©lope Cruz, among others. PenÃ©lope will star as Enzo's wife Laura Ferrari and Shailene will play Enzo's mistress Lina Lardi. 'Ferrari' is expected to release in 2023.

233.title: Goa CM ate non-veg food before visiting temple: Congress leader
233.article_body: Congress leader Ramesh Kanchan claimed Goa CM Pramod Sawant ate non-vegetarian food during a lunch organised for him before visiting the Sri Krishna temple in Karnataka. The organiser refuted the claims and said the menu was restricted to vegetarian items only. MLA Raghupathi Bhat, who was with Sawant, said non-vegetarian food was only provided to the officials accompanying the CM.

234.title: He never aged for me, he's still the same: Balki on Big B's b'day
234.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki, speaking on Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, said, "I always tell him, 'You're pretending to be 80, show me proof of your age...I don't believe you're 80'." "For me, he has never aged. He's still the same, will always be the same," Balki added. The duo have worked together in several films, including 'Cheeni Kum', 'Paa' and 'Shamitabh'.

235.title: Artist Sudarsan pays tribute to Mulayam Singh with sand sculpture
235.article_body: Sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik created a sand sculpture at Puri beach in Odisha to pay tribute to late Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav on Monday. The sculpture had an impression of Yadav with engravings reading, "Tribute to Mulayam Singh Yadav. Om Shanti." Pattnaik, who was awarded the Padma Shri in 2014, shared a picture of the art on Twitter.

236.title: Kuldeep's form and year 2022 just keeps getting better: Irfan Pathan
236.article_body: Praising India spinner Kuldeep Yadav following his 4/18 in third ODI against South Africa, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Kuldeep Yadav's form and year 2022 just keeps getting better. Good for Indian cricket." The 27-year-old was adjudged 'Player of the Match'. This is the first time since January 2019 that Kuldeep has taken four wickets in an ODI innings.

237.title: Felt my career was over after getting hypersexualised: Scarlett Johansson
237.article_body: Hollywood actress Scarlett Johansson revealed she became objectified in a way where she felt she wasn't getting offers for work that she wanted to do. "Everybody thought I was older...I'd been [acting] for a long time, I got...pigeonholed into this weird hypersexualised thing. I felt like [my career] was over," she added. Scarlett said it was scary at that time.

238.title: J&K is striding fast on path of development: MoS John Barla
238.article_body: Union Minister of State for Minority Affairs John Barla on Tuesday said that Jammu and Kashmir is striding fast on the path of development. "Various projects will be sanctioned in Ramban for welfare of minorities," Barla said. John Barla visited Ramban district as part of the Centre's third phase of the public outreach programme in Jammu and Kashmir.

239.title: Tripura being used for Myanmar-Bangladesh drug trade: CM Saha
239.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha said his state, along with Assam and Mizoram, is a corridor for Myanmar-based traffickers to send drugs to Bangladesh. He said the state has requested the Centre to strengthen BSF's presence and create an NCB unit in the state. He added that Amit Shah had warned that arms and ammunition might also be trafficked.

240.title: President Droupadi Murmu to visit Assam on October 13 & 14
240.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu will visit Assam on October 13 and 14, where she will take part in several government programmes. The President will also visit Kamakhya Temple on October 14. "The President...will inaugurate Dhubri Medical College and Hospital and will attend a civic programme to be held at Assam Administrative Staff College," Assam Tourism Minister Jayanta Malla Baruah said.

241.title: UP BJP MLA gets 2-year jail term in Muzaffarnagar riots case, granted bail later
241.article_body: A special court on Tuesday sentenced Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Vikram Saini and 11 others to two years' imprisonment in the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots case. They were taken into custody and later granted bail after they furnished two sureties for filing an appeal in the high court against their conviction. The court convicted them of rioting and other offences.

242.title: Iran's morality police once detained me, took me to 're-education centre': Elnaaz
242.article_body: Actress Elnaaz Norouzi, who recently expressed her support to anti-hijab protests in her native country Iran, revealed she had an encounter with the country's morality police. "I went to this 're-education centre'...They take your phone [and]...ID," she stated. Elnaaz added she was let go of in just one day because her family took help from their contacts on the inside.

243.title: India had 'very difficult' 2.5 years in its ties with China: S Jaishankar
243.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "We had a two-and-a-half very difficult years in our relationship with China." He added, "It included the first bloodshed we've had on the border after 40 years and where we actually lost 20 soldiers." He also said, "But our endeavour, my endeavour has been to keep the communication lines going."

244.title: My last relationship taught me not to gift pets: Sidharth Malhotra
244.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, during a rapid-fire round, revealed his last relationship taught him never to gift pets. Later, Sidharth said he'll steal Alia Bhatt's cat. The actor was rumoured to be dating Alia. During Sidharth's recent appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', he was asked to name one thing he missed about her ex, to which, he replied her cat.

245.title: It was tough, didn't help scoring just 99: SA skipper Miller on 3rd ODI loss
245.article_body: South Africa skipper David Miller said the seven-wicket loss against India in third ODI at Arun Jaitley Stadium was "very tough". "Didn't help scoring just 99. Disappointing result today," he added. South Africa were bowled out for 99 in 27.1 overs after being put in to bat first. India scored 105/3 in 19.1 overs to win the three-match series 2-1.

246.title: Essential food items' prices soar in Tunisia amid economic crisis
246.article_body: Food prices in Tunisia have soared recently, giving rise to fears of an oncoming economic crisis. Vegetable oil, sugar, rice and even packaged water are in short supply. Tunisians are standing in long lines to procure these essential items which are now being rationed. The government has blamed hoarders, the war in Ukraine and speculative buying for the situation.

247.title: Oil prices fall amid fears of possible global recession
247.article_body: Oil prices reported a fall of nearly 2% on Tuesday amid fears of a possible global recession and concerns over global demand due to rising COVID-19 cases in China. Brent crude was down 1.7% to $94.56 per barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude dropped 2% to $89.31/barrel. Notably, IMF has cut the global growth outlook for 2023 to 2.7%.

248.title: What multiple records did India break in 3rd ODI against South Africa?
248.article_body: The 3rd ODI marked India's biggest win while chasing against South Africa in terms of balls remaining (185). India dismissed South Africa below 100 in an ODI for the first time. India also equalled the record for most wins in international cricket in a calendar year (38). India have now won the most number of ODI series (five) in 2022.

249.title: OTT will be a parallel industry to theatres: Actor Rajkummar Rao
249.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has said that OTT platforms will be a parallel industry to theatres. Rajkummar stated that theatres and OTT platforms will beautifully co-exist as people love watching both films and web projects. "What the OTT platforms have done is that they've created...many opportunities for...many people who were not getting the kind of work that they deserve," Rajkummar added.

250.title: Apple may roll out 5G support for iPhone in India by Dec: Report
250.article_body: Apple may roll out 5G support for users of iPhone 12 and newer models in India by December this year, according to reports. Apple is reportedly extensively testing its 5G iPhone models on both Airtel and Reliance Jio's 5G networks. Senior executives from Apple and Airtel will also meet this week to discuss the rollout timeline.

251.title: Man dies while 'performing stunts' on moving train in Punjab
251.article_body: A man died while allegedly performing stunts on a moving train near Khanna in Punjab's Ludhiana district. The deceased's head hit a pole while hanging out of the door of the train coach, police said. The incident was captured in a 17-second video following which the Government Railway Police (GRP) was trying to identify the deceased.

252.title: Palestinian minor succumbs to gunshot wound from Israeli army raid
252.article_body: A 12-year-old Palestinian boy on Monday succumbed to gunshot wounds inflicted by Israeli soldiers during an army raid in September on a refugee camp in West Bank, Palestinian officials said. The Israeli army said it was aware of an allegation regarding injuries to a minor who participated in "violent riots". The circumstances surrounding the event are being examined, it added.

253.title: Box office has become more important than films: Shekhar Kapur
253.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur took to Twitter and wrote that box office collections are becoming "far more important than the film itself". "Even for audiences," he added. "I can't ever remember looking at first week's box office collections of 'Masoom' or 'Mr India'. And over 30 years later, people are still watching these films," Shekhar further wrote.

254.title: Don't recall allowing RSS camps in govt schools: K'taka minister
254.article_body: Karnataka minister Kota Shrinivas Poojari said he does not remember giving RSS permission to run training camps in government schools. "We permitted other organisations for personality development programs. I don't think RSS even asked for permission," said Poojari. Earlier, a report claimed that a government body gave RSS permission to conduct camps in Kolar and Uttara Kannada districts.

255.title: Happy with my performance: Siraj on winning Player of the Series award
255.article_body: After Mohammed Siraj was named 'Player of the Series' against South Africa, the India pacer said, "Performing against a good team gives you a lot of confidence." He added, "I had to take responsibility. I try to figure out...right lengths at the start of the innings...Happy with my performance." Siraj took total five wickets in the three-match ODI series.

256.title: A true genius and prodigy: Raina to Hardik on his 29th birthday
256.article_body: Wishing India all-rounder Hardik Pandya on his 29th birthday, Suresh Raina took to Twitter and wrote, "Happy birthday to one of the finest players...a true genius and a prodigy to so many who aspire to become like you." Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "May you have an outstanding year ahead. Wish you [the] best of health, life and career."

257.title: Cong is 'sinking ship', people there will come to BJP: Karnataka CM
257.article_body: Karnataka CM and BJP leader Basavaraj Bommai called the Congress a "sinking ship" on Tuesday. He claimed that those who are in the Congress will come to BJP's side in a few days. Addressing a gathering in poll-bound Karnataka, Bommai said the BJP will place its report card before people and will return to power once again in the state.

258.title: Flood-hit Pakistan to buy 6 million mosquito nets from India: Report
258.article_body: As per a report, Pakistan's health ministry has approved the purchase of over six million mosquito nets from India amid the spread of vector-borne diseases in the country due to floods. The WHO is using financial resources provided by Global Fund to acquire the nets for Pakistan, the report added. Officials said malaria is spreading rapidly in 32 flood-affected districts.

259.title: Anytime a white-ball team like India turns up runs are on offer: Ish Sodhi
259.article_body: New Zealand spinner Ish Sodhi said he's looking forward to the bilateral series against India after the T20 World Cup. "New Zealand, I guess, is renowned for its small boundaries. Anytime a white-ball team like India turns up, I think there are always going to be runs on offer," he added. India-New Zealand will play three T20Is and three ODIs.

260.title: Alcohol comes out of hand pump in MP, police bust illicit liquor den
260.article_body: While raiding a hooch den in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, police started pumping a hand pump and found alcohol coming out of it. After digging, they found tanks filled with illicit liquor buried about seven feet in the ground. Police said the traders extracted the liquor from the hand pump and sold it by filling it in polythene bags.

261.title: PM 'whitewashed real history': Cong on PM Modi's criticism of Nehru
261.article_body: Congress on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi for his apparent dig at Jawaharlal Nehru on the Kashmir issue, alleging that he has once again "whitewashed real history" and overlooked facts to "castigate" India's first PM. PM on Monday said that Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel resolved issues related to the merger of princely states but "one person" couldn't solve the Kashmir issue.

262.title: Scientists map 'graveyard of stars' in our galaxy for the 1st time, pics released
262.article_body: Scientists from The University of Sydney have announced that a graveyard of ancient stars has been mapped in the Milky Way galaxy for the first time. The 'galactic underworld' stretches three times the height of the Milky Way, the researchers said. They have charted "the corpses of once massive suns that have since collapsed into black holes and neutron stars".

263.title: Shah Rukh Khan pens note on Big B's 80th b'day, calls him 'superhuman'
263.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter and wished Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday. "One thing to learn from this great man, actor, superstar, father...superhuman is to never back away...instead learn...level up and launch again and again...forever," he tweeted. Along with the tweet, he shared a video with Amitabh where both sing 'Ek Doosre Se Karte Hain Pyaar Hum'.

264.title: Serious debt crisis unfolding across developing countries: UNDP
264.article_body: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) has said that a serious debt crisis is now unfolding across developing economies. It further estimated that 54 countries are in need of immediate debt relief to avoid even more extreme poverty. "It is urgent...to step up and find ways in which we can deal with these issues before they become...unmanageable," it added.

265.title: TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya sent to 14-day ED custody in SSC scam
265.article_body: TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya was on Tuesday sent to 14-day ED custody in connection with the School Service Commission (SSC) scam case. He was arrested by the probe agency earlier in the day. The ED earlier arrested former state minister Partha Chatterjee and his close aide Arpita Mukherjee in this case.

266.title: India have played some timid cricket in ICC events: Nasser Hussain
266.article_body: Ex-England skipper Nasser Hussain said that India's issues have been ICC events. "They (India) have been going around beating everyone, with a variety of players," Hussain said. He added, "But the truth is that they have played some timid cricket in world events...They have got to keep the same mindset they have had in the bilateral events."

267.title: 2,000 left without power after Ukrainian strike: Russian official
267.article_body: The governor of Russia's Belgorod region on Tuesday said that more than 2,000 people had been left without power following Ukrainian shelling that hit an electricity substation in the town of Shebekino. The Russian town is located near the border with Ukraine's Kharkiv region. Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov said that emergency services were working to restore the power supply.

268.title: YouTube introduces account handles to allow users to tag each other
268.article_body: YouTube has introduced account handles to make it easier for users to interact and tag other users. Handles will appear on channel pages and Shorts so that they will be instantly and consistently recognisable. Handles can be used to tag users in comments or video titles. YouTube will inform users over next month when they can choose their channel's handle.

269.title: Gujarat's BJP govt deliberately kept Amreli district backward: AAP
269.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Tuesday alleged that the BJP-led Gujarat government deliberately kept Amreli district backward. He said that there's a serious water problem in the district, adding that water comes once in three-four days at no fixed time. The population of Amreli is decreasing every year because people are migrating to other places.

270.title: 2 men sentenced to 20 years in prison for rape in Rajasthan
270.article_body: A special court in Rajasthan's Bundi sentenced two men to 20 years in prison for raping a 20-year-old woman with hearing and speech impairment in February 2020. The court also imposed a fine of â‚¹1 lakh on 24-year-old Lalaram Meena and 23-year-old Munesh Bairwa, public prosecutor Mahaveer Prasad Meghwal said. The statements of 15 witnesses were recorded, Meghwal said.

271.title: Credit Suisse may see $8 bn shortfall in 2024: Goldman Sachs
271.article_body: Goldman Sachs Group has said that Swiss lender Credit Suisse will face a capital shortfall of as much as $8 billion in 2024. Analysts have said that restructuring of Credit Suisse is required while capital generation is low. Further, they said, "Credit Suisse continues to face cyclical and structural challenges" and maintained sale recommendation of the stock.

272.title: Troll shares stats and calls Aakash Chopra 'failed cricketer', former cricketer responds
272.article_body: Reacting to a video of Aakash Chopra, a troll shared statistics and called Chopra a "failed cricketer". "What's this...How can you talk about cricket?" the troll tweeted. Aakash responded, "I googled you...found no career in cricket or otherwise...Going by your logic...how can you talk about me? When you a ________ person in life...On a serious note...Get a life...my friend...Love you."

273.title: Big B started calling me 'maalkin' during 'Waqt...' shoot: Shefali Shah
273.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed that Amitabh Bachchan started calling her 'maalkin' while they were shooting for the 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time'. "I was giving [husband and film's director] Vipul Shah some gyaan...Amit ji was standing...he said, 'Should we keep the director or change him also' (laughs). So from then on, he calls me maalkin," she stated.

274.title: Wicket was perfect: Kuldeep on his 4/18 in India's win in 3rd ODI vs SA
274.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Match' in India's seven wicket-win against South Africa in third ODI, spinner Kuldeep Yadav said the wicket was perfect at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. "I am enjoying my bowling. I am not thinking too much about the result, just focussing on the process and...on my rhythm," he added. Kuldeep posted bowling figures of 4.1-1-18-4.

275.title: Uber shuts down in 5 Pak cities, to continue services via Careem
275.article_body: Uber has said that it will discontinue its services in five Pakistani cities including Karachi and Islamabad. Multan, Faisalabad and Peshawar are the other cities where operations will be stopped. Uber said that drivers and riders can switch to Careem, the Dubai-based company it bought. Uber will continue its operations in Lahore, where it also plans on launching new products.

276.title: Those claiming to be JP's disciples abandoned his ideology: Amit Shah
276.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday criticised the ruling coalition in Bihar and said those who claim to be disciples of Jayaprakash Narayan have abandoned his ideology. Attending the 120th birth anniversary celebrations of the socialist leader in Bihar's Saran district, Shah said Loknayak Jayaprakash Narayan spent his whole life for the welfare of the landless, poor, downtrodden and backward.

277.title: PM Modi offers prayers at Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga in MP's Ujjain
277.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday offered prayers at the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain. PM Modi later inaugurated the first phase of the more than 900-metre-long Shri Mahakal Lok corridor. It is built as one of the largest such corridors in the country. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Governor Mangubhai Patel were also present there.

278.title: Gyanvapi case hearing on carbon dating of 'Shivling' adjourned to Oct 14
278.article_body: A court in Varanasi adjourned the hearing on a petition seeking carbon dating of the alleged 'Shivling' found in Gyanvapi Mosque to October 14. The plea was disputed by the Muslim side, which claimed the structure is a "fountain". Advocate Mumtaz Ahmed said if the object gets damaged during carbon dating, it would amount to defiance of Supreme Court's order.

279.title: Worst is yet to come, 2023 will feel like a recession: IMF
279.article_body: The International Monetary Fund's (IMF) chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas on Tuesday said, "The worst is yet to come, and for many people, 2023 will feel like a recession." He added, "The US, China and the euro area will continue to stall." The IMF cut the global growth outlook for 2023 to 2.7%, down from the 2.9% estimated in July.

280.title: Malaysia's 97-yr-old ex-PM Mahathir to run in general elections
280.article_body: Malaysia's 97-year-old former PM Mahathir Mohamad on Tuesday announced that he will contest the general elections expected next month, in a bid to defend his parliamentary seat. "We haven't decided on who will be PM as it is only relevant if we win," he said. Mahathir has served as Malaysia's PM for a total of 24 years, in two terms.

281.title: NASAâ€™s Dragonfly to land on dunes & shattered ice on Saturnâ€™s moon in 2034
281.article_body: NASA's Dragonfly rotorcraft is scheduled to land on the Selk Crater region of Saturn's moon Titan in 2034. The region is a patchwork of sand dunes and broken-up ice. "Dragonfly will land in an equatorial, dry region of Titan, a frigid, thick-atmosphere, hydrocarbon world. It rains liquid methane sometimes, but it's more like a desert on Earth," a researcher said.

282.title: Shweta Bachchan shares unseen pics of Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday
282.article_body: On the occasion of actor Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, his daughter Shweta Bachchan shared some unseen pictures on Instagram. One of the pictures shows Shweta during her childhood as Amitabh holds her hand, while another photo shows Amitabh during his childhood days. One of them also shows Amitabh reading a holy scripture during a puja ceremony.

283.title: Raveena shares childhood pic with Amitabh on his b'day, pens note
283.article_body: Raveena Tandon took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish Amitabh Bachchan on his birthday. She shared an old picture where she could be seen sitting on her father's lap, who was seated next to Amitabh at an event. "Wishing you health, happiness...Will always be in awe, since then to now, no one was, or will ever be you," Raveena wrote.

284.title: I didn't know what Oscars were: 'Chhello Show' actor Bhavin Rabari
284.article_body: 'Chhello Show' actor Bhavin Rabari revealed he didn't know what the Oscars were. "I was told, 'The film has been selected for the Oscars'. That's when I came to know what the Oscars are," he added. Bhavin stated he didn't even like movies much, however, he has started liking them "little little". "Watching films is rare for us," Bhavin added.

285.title: Ola, Uber, Rapido need separate licence to run autos in K'taka: State govt
285.article_body: The Karnataka Transport Department on Tuesday directed cab and bike aggregators Ola, Uber and Rapido to apply for a separate license to run three-wheeler auto-rickshaws on their respective platforms. Transport Commissioner THM Kumar stated that companies are asked to stop plying auto services from Wednesday. Companies violating the order will be charged a fine of â‚¹5,000 per vehicle per day.

286.title: They are very smart & bright: Katrina on co-stars Siddhant, Ishaan
286.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif in an interview shared her experience of working with Ishaan Khatter and Siddhant Chaturvedi in the upcoming horror-comedy film 'Phone Bhoot'. She said that both the actors are "very smart" and "very bright", adding that they are good at improvisation. "For me, that was something required in a film like this," Katrina said.

287.title: 16 Dalits, including pregnant woman, kept locked up & tortured by man in K'taka
287.article_body: Sixteen people belonging to the Schedule Castes were allegedly kept locked up and tortured at a coffee plantation in Karnataka's Chikkamagaluru for 15 days, officials said. The accused, a BJP supporter named Jagadeesha Gowda, allegedly tortured a two-month-pregnant woman who lost her baby due to the assault, police said. Jagadeesha and his son Tilak Gowda are on the run.

288.title: It's a tough one: Steyn on Bumrah's replacement for T20 WC squad
288.article_body: Ex-South African bowler Dale Steyn said that to name a replacement for injured pacer Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup squad is a "tough one". "Whoever gets selected, you probably want them to raise their game by a small percentage because of the hole that they are filling. It's so difficult to fill his (Bumrah) place," Steyn said.

289.title: Proud of the boys, the way they played: Dhawan on India's 2-1 ODIs win vs SA
289.article_body: Following India's 2-1 ODI series win against South Africa, India captain Shikhar Dhawan said he's proud of the team and the way they played showing maturity and carried the responsibility in the three-match series. "The boys showed great character on such tough batting pitches...bowlers were clinical today," he added. India defeated South Africa by seven wickets in third ODI.

290.title: PM Modi inaugurates 900-metre-long Mahakal Lok corridor in MP's Ujjain
290.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi dedicated the first phase of the 900-metre-long Shri Mahakal Lok corridor, located in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain, to the nation on Tuesday. The total cost of the project is reportedly around â‚¹850 crore. The project is aimed at helping in enriching the experience of pilgrims and boosting tourism in the city.

291.title: Asset reconstruction companies can act as resolution applicants under IBC: RBI
291.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has allowed asset reconstruction companies (ARCs) to act as resolution applicants under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC). RBI said that ARCs should have a minimum Net Owned Fund (NOF) of â‚¹1,000 crore to be eligible. The ARC should also have a board-approved policy regarding taking up the role of resolution applicant.

292.title: We complicate it due to fear: Rakul on celebs keeping their love life private
292.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about celebrities hiding their relationships, has said, "We just complicate it due to fear and I don't operate with fear." "I'd rather not have people intrude with 'is there something happening'. Rather, I'd say it's all here so stop chasing me...asking me the same question," she added. Rakul said she doesn't like all the speculations.

293.title: World no. 1 Alcaraz got to realise that he's everybody's target: Connors
293.article_body: Talking about Carlos Alcaraz, who won US Open 2022 and became the youngest world number one in men's tennis, Jimmy Connors said the 19-year-old Spaniard got to realise that he's everyone's target. Alcaraz's first ATP Tour-level match as the number one ranked player ended with a straight-set defeat to David Goffin in the Astana Open first round last week.

294.title: National Games will build formidable hockey team for Paris Olympics: Reid
294.article_body: Indian men's hockey team chief coach Graham Reid said that the ongoing 36th National Games would help in building a formidable team for the 2024 Paris Olympics. "This is the first National Games I am watching...The most important aspect is many youngsters have showcased their talent which could come in handy in building a good [team] for Olympics," Reid said.

295.title: Gold price drops by over â‚¹300; silver falls below â‚¹59,000/kg
295.article_body: Gold prices fell by more than â‚¹300 to â‚¹51,105 per 10 grams in Delhi on Tuesday amid a decline in the prices of the precious metal in the international market, according to HDFC Securities. Meanwhile, the price of silver also dipped by â‚¹1,071 to â‚¹58,652 per kilogram from â‚¹59,723 per kilogram.

296.title: Uddhav's Sena carry 'flaming torch' to Bal Thackeray's memorial
296.article_body: Workers of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena visited Bal Thackeray's memorial on Tuesday in Mumbai carrying a flaming torch with them, a day after the EC allotted a 'mashaal' symbol to the party faction. The party workers also visited 'Matoshree', the private residence of former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, with a burning torch in their hands.

297.title: Finance ministry seeks expenditure proposals for supplementary demands
297.article_body: Finance Ministry has asked ministries and departments to submit expenditure proposals for the first batch of Supplementary Demands for Grants for 2022-23. The ministry said that the first batch is proposed to be placed before Parliament in the ensuing winter session. The eligible cases to be incorporated include those where advances from the Contingency Fund of India have been granted.

298.title: Maharashtra BJP leader shoots himself dead with revolver at his house
298.article_body: Maharashtra BJP's Beed city chief Bhagirath Biyani allegedly shot himself dead with a licenced revolver at his house on Tuesday. His family members rushed him to a hospital, where he was declared dead on arrival. Biyani, who was in his 50s, was suffering from some health issues, as per a police official.

299.title: Students run behind K'taka govt bus to reach school; video surfaces
299.article_body: A video has surfaced on Twitter, showing several students running behind a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus as the driver reportedly drives past a designated bus stop. "Shame on you that you don't respect pass-holders," a Twitter user said. The KSRTC, responding to the video, asked for the bus stop's name and vehicle number for "further appropriate action".

300.title: North Korea releases pics of Kim Jong-un watching missile launch
300.article_body: North Korea released several photos of its leader Kim Jong-un overseeing a missile launch at an undisclosed location. The KCNA state news agency said that Kim Jong-un guided recent exercises by nuclear tactical operation units in response to large-scale navy drills by South Korean and US forces. Over the past two weeks, North Korea carried out exercises involving ballistic missiles.

301.title: Protests continue at Bangalore University after bus ran over student
301.article_body: Bangalore University saw a second consecutive day of protests by students after a state-run bus ran over a mathematics student on Monday. Students are calling for a ban on public vehicles inside the university campus and have also closed all gates. The injured student is being treated at a private hospital and police have been deployed inside the campus.

302.title: Bank of England announces bond intervention to stabilise bond market
302.article_body: The Bank of England expanded its efforts to restore the country's bond market to include inflation-linked bonds amid continuing concerns about the government's budget. The bank said that it will widen its purchases of UK government bonds up to Â£10 billion of long-term bonds a day, including Â£5 billion of conventional bonds and Â£5 billion of index-linked bonds.

303.title: Sri Lankan man jumps into sea, swims to Indian shore
303.article_body: A 24-year-old man, who fled Sri Lanka in a boat to India, reportedly jumped into the sea while nearing Tamil Nadu coast and swam around 6-8 nautical miles to reach the Indian shore. The man had joined a 5-member family on the boat that left from Talaimannar in Sri Lanka on October 8. He had an expired Sri Lankan passport.

304.title: Army Day parade moves out of Delhi, to be held in Bengaluru in 2023
304.article_body: Next year's Army Day parade will be held in Bengaluru as part of initiatives to hold major events outside the National Capital Region. Army Day is held on January 15 to mark the first Indian officer taking over as Commander-in-Chief in 1949. The wreath-laying ceremony at the National War Memorial in Delhi would take place a day before the parade.

305.title: Supreme Court admits pleas against 'Talaq-e-Hasan'
305.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday admitted the pleas seeking a ban on 'Talaq-e-Hasan' and all other forms of "unilateral extrajudicial divorce". 'Talaq-e-Hasan' is a form of divorce wherein a Muslim man can dissolve his marriage by pronouncing the word "talaq" once a month, for three months. The matter has been listed for hearing in the third week of January 2023.

306.title: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast for current financial year to 6.8%
306.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) cut its gross domestic product (GDP) growth forecast for India for the current financial year to 6.8%. This marks a 0.6% downgrade since the July forecast in which IMF had projected a GDP growth of 7.4% for India. Moreover, IMF cut its global growth outlook for 2022 to 3.2%.

307.title: Corporates barred from being consortium members in IDBI sale
307.article_body: Large corporates have been barred from being even a minority shareholder in consortium planning to bid for 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank as per RBI guidelines. RBI guidelines allow industrial houses to hold a maximum of 10% stake in private sector banks, but they cannot be a promoter. The last date for submitting Expression of Interest (EOI) is December 16.

308.title: A lot of people had written off Hardik: Pandya's childhood coach Kiran More
308.article_body: Ex-cricketer and childhood coach of all-rounder Hardik Pandya, Kiran More spoke about the former's comeback into the Indian team. "When he went to play in the IPL, I had the belief that Hardik would prove his critics wrong," More said. He added, "A lot of people had written him off but I was confident that he would do something special."

309.title: Chinese firm XPENG tests its electric flying taxi in Dubai
309.article_body: Chinese tech and EV firm XPENG undertook the first successful flight of its flying taxi 'X2' in Dubai's Marina district on Monday. The test was an unmanned flight, though XPENG claims that it has tested manned flights earlier. The two-seater vehicle can reach speeds of up to 130 km/h and is outfitted with vertical take-off and landing capabilities.

310.title: Teenage boy, girl found murdered on road to school in MP; probe ordered
310.article_body: The bodies of an 18-year-old boy and a 16-year-old girl were found on the road to the girl's school in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district on Monday. As per the initial investigation, the teenagers were reportedly attacked with sharp-edged weapons on their necks. The police have interrogated villagers and families of the deceased to discover the reason behind the killings.

311.title: India-UAE relations are witnessing unprecedented momentum: Piyush Goyal
311.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal, at the 10th UAE-India high level joint task force meeting on investments, said India-UAE relations are witnessing unprecedented momentum and large number of opportunities for cooperation exist in key sectors like infrastructure and technology. India also announced plan to establish a Fast Track Mechanism in UAE to resolve issues faced by Indian businesses in UAE.

312.title: Sajid Khan should be allowed to work in Bigg Boss: FWICE to Anurag Thakur
312.article_body: The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has written to I&B Minister Anurag Thakur, informing him that Sajid Khan served a ban of one year for multiple sexual harassment allegations against him. FWICE said Sajid should be allowed to participate in 'Bigg Boss 16'. This comes after DCW chief Swati Maliwal wrote to Anurag, seeking Sajid's removal from show.

313.title: Congress leaders observe 2-min silence for Mulayam Singh during yatra
313.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and other party leaders observed two minutes' silence in memory of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav during the ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra on Tuesday. Congress shared a video of yatris observing silence on Twitter. The party had earlier called Yadav's demise "an irreparable loss to Indian politics". The 82-year-old was cremated in Uttar Pradesh.

314.title: 22-yr-old Haaland reveals he consumes 6,000 calories in a day, eats cow's heart and liver
314.article_body: Manchester City's 22-year-old forward Erling Haaland has revealed that he consumes around 6,000 calories in a day. He further stated that his diet includes cow's heart and liver. "[Other people] don't eat this, but I am concerned with taking care of my body. I think eating quality food that is as local as possible is the most important," he stated.

315.title: Rhino hit by truck in Assam doing well; CM shares drone video
315.article_body: The rhinoceros who was injured after being hit by a truck in Assam's Haldibari recently is found to be doing good, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Tuesday. He also shared a drone video taken this morning. "Urge all to be kind to our animals. Go slow while passing through corridors, where you know some animals might cross," he added.

316.title: Power Grid acquires SPV to establish inter-state transmission system
316.article_body: Power Grid Corporation of India said it has acquired 100% equity in ER NER Transmission (ETL) under tariff-based competitive bidding. According to the company's filing, ETL will serve as a special-purpose vehicle to build an interstate transmission project. The project consists of upgradation works at 400/132kV Banka (Bihar) and building 220kV D/C transmission lines in Assam and Arunachal Pradesh.

317.title: Liquor smuggling accused's illegal properties demolished in Haryana
317.article_body: The Haryana Police on Tuesday demolished two illegal buildings built on government land in Sonipat district. The structures belonged to a man allegedly involved in over 18 cases of liquor smuggling, police said. Joint teams comprising the district police and the municipal committee demolished the structures with the help of bulldozers and JCB machines.

318.title: AIIMS Delhi considering system to refer patients to other hospitals
318.article_body: Director of All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi, Dr M Srinivas is set to discuss with representatives of 20 hospitals near the AIIMS premises a mechanism to refer stable patients from its emergency ward. The referral system is expected to reduce the number of patients waiting outside the AIIMS Emergency section due to a shortage of admission beds.

319.title: Boney breaks down remembering Sridevi at event marking 10 yrs of 'English...'
319.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor broke down while talking about his late actress-wife Sridevi at an event celebrating 10 years of her film 'English Vinglish'. A video showing Boney being consoled by filmmaker R Balki has also surfaced online. Sridevi passed away in 2018 while she was in Dubai to attend a family wedding.

320.title: Bommai panic-stricken over response to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in K'taka: Cong
320.article_body: The Congress on Tuesday criticised the BJP and said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai is panic-stricken over the response that the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is getting in his state. Congress leader Randeep Surjewala accused Bommai of running a "corrupt" and "incompetent" government. "Your incompetence is becoming legendary and your mal-administration is exemplary. Stop fooling people," Surjewala tweeted.

321.title: DU extends registration deadline for admissions till October 12
321.article_body: The Delhi University (DU) has announced that the registration deadline for admissions to the university has been extended by two days, till October 12. According to an official statement, the decision was taken in the "interest of the candidates who are still in the process of deciding their preferences". Candidates can apply at the DU website: admission.uod.ac.in.

322.title: Intel confirms its proprietary source code has been exposed: Report
322.article_body: Intel has reportedly confirmed that its 'Alder Lake BIOS' source code has been leaked by a third-party in a 6GB file containing tools and code for building and optimising 'BIOS/UEFI' images. The BIOS/UEFI code works to initialise a computer's hardware before the operating system has loaded.  "We don't believe this exposes any new security vulnerabilities," an Intel spokesperson said.

323.title: Germany will make it through winter if we continue to adapt: Scholz
323.article_body: Germany will make it through the winter if its citizens, companies and policymakers continue to adapt to the country's changed energy situation, Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday. Germany has almost achieved its target of having its gas storage facilities 95% full, he added. Europe is facing an unprecedented energy crisis due to tensions with Russia over the Ukraine war.

324.title: Javed Akhtar says Dharmendra refused to do Big B's 'Zanjeer', actor reacts
324.article_body: Dharmendra reacted after lyricist Javed Akhtar stated that the veteran actor had rejected Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Zanjeer'. Dharmendra tweeted, "Reality often remains unheard in this world full of show-offs." "Refusing 'Zanjeer' was an emotional hurdle which I have mentioned in 'Aap ki Adalat'. So please don't misunderstand me," Dharmendra wrote in another tweet.

325.title: Safex Chemicals acquires UK's Briar Chemicals in Â£73 million deal
325.article_body: Agro-chemical firm Safex Chemicals India said that it has acquired Briar Chemicals for Â£73 million from German investment firm AURELIUS Equity Opportunities. Neeraj Jindal, Director of Safex, has joined the Board of Briar Chemicals and will oversee its future growth. Piyush Jindal, Director of Safex, said the company has entered the UK market through this acquisition.

326.title: Ghaziabad civic body identifies 14 waterlogging spots in city
326.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation said that they conducted inspections and identified 14 waterlogging spots in the city which require immediate intervention. "There were more than 100 such low-lying areas and these have now been reduced to only 14. We have directed teams to deploy pumps and draw out stagnant water," said Nitin Gaur, GMC Commissioner.

327.title: Man fires at booth staff after being asked for toll in MP; video surfaces
327.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man firing at toll booth attendants after they allegedly refused his request to be treated as a VIP and asked him to pay toll charges in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. The man took two cars, one carrying a family, through the Baretha toll booth. An employee near the man narrowly escaped from being shot.

328.title: Infosys President Ravi Kumar S resigns
328.article_body: Infosys on Tuesday announced the resignation of the company's President Ravi Kumar S, effective October 11, 2022. "The Board of Directors placed on record their deep sense of appreciation for the services rendered by Ravi Kumar S for his contributions to the company," Infosys said in a regulatory filing. Ravi led Infosys Global Services Organization across all industry segments.

329.title: Nobody should have to go to jail for smoking weed: US Vice President Kamala Harris
329.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris backed Joe Biden administration's decision to pardon thousands of Americans convicted of simple marijuana possession, saying "nobody should have to go to jail for smoking weed". Harris said the pardons were the first step in taking further action on decriminalising marijuana across the nation. "We're urging governors and states to take our lead," she stated.

330.title: BJP workers wave slippers, call TMC MLA Manik 'chor' near WB court
330.article_body: BJP workers waved slippers and chanted "chor, chor" (thief, thief) as TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya was brought to West Bengal's Bankshall Court on Tuesday. A video showed the workers chanting, "Chor aaya chor aaya" (The thief is here). The former President of the West Bengal Board of Primary Education has been arrested in connection with the teacher recruitment scam case.

331.title: 22-yr-old dies after wall of toilet collapses in UP's Budaun
331.article_body: A 22-year-old youth, Virendra, died after the wall of a toilet in his house collapsed following heavy rains in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun, police said. The deceased, a resident of Nagla Taru village, died in the incident that occurred on Monday evening, police added. The family members of the youth rushed him to a hospital where he was declared dead.

332.title: Family of Thane man killed in accident gets â‚¹30 lakh compensation
332.article_body: Motor Accident Claims Tribunal has awarded â‚¹30.19 lakh as compensation to the parents of a 24-year-old man who died in a road accident in Thane. The man had died after a generator van rammed into the two-wheeler on which he was travelling with his girlfriend. The van's owner and its insurance company have been directed to jointly pay the compensation.

333.title: 15 students, driver hurt as school buses collide in TN's Cuddalore
333.article_body: At least 15 students and a driver were injured after two school buses collided near Virudhachalam in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore on Tuesday. As per reports, the accident took place when one of the buses was racing with the other vehicle belonging to the same institution. The injured students were rushed to a hospital in Virudhachalam for treatment.

334.title: India equal world record for most wins in a year, clinch ODI series against South Africa
334.article_body: India defeated South Africa by seven wickets in the third ODI to clinch the series 2-1. India equalled the world record for most victories in international cricket in a calendar year by winning 38 matches in 2022. Australia had set the record with 38 victories in 2003. The match witnessed South Africa record their lowest-ever ODI total (99) against India.

335.title: Reserve 10-15% hospital beds for patients of vector-borne diseases: Delhi govt
335.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said all hospitals in Delhi have been asked to reserve 10-15% beds for patients of vector-borne diseases. "The government has put all hospitals across Delhi on alert and is keeping an eye on the situation. Hospitals have been directed to...ensure that no patient is denied admission due to lack of beds," Sisodia added.

336.title: Very sad to lose a friend whom I had known since 1974: Swamy on Mulayam
336.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy expressed his condolences on the demise of former UP CM and the founder of Samajwadi Party, Mulayam Singh Yadav. "Very sad to lose a friend (Mulayam) whom I had known since 1974. A man of large heart and [trust] which many took advantage of, but he never complained and remained cheerful," Swamy said.

337.title: Make sex reassignment surgeries free at hospitals: DCW to Delhi govt
337.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued a notice to the Delhi government, seeking an order to all government hospitals with necessary facilities, to provide free sex reassignment surgeries (SRS) to transgender people. The notice said that the Delhi government is providing the treatment free of cost at one hospital, it can do the same at all government hospitals.

338.title: PM couldn't attend Mulayam's funeral, asked me to pay tributes: Rajnath
338.article_body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh, who attended Mulayam Singh Yadav's funeral in UP's Saifai on Tuesday, said PM Narendra Modi asked him to pay tributes to the late SP founder as he couldn't attend the funeral. "We had a very strong relationship...Mulayam Singh Yadav was a big personality in Indian politics," Rajnath said. Several other leaders were present there.

339.title: Eknath Shinde faction of Shiv Sena gets '2 swords & shieldâ€™ as election symbol
339.article_body: The Election Commission has allotted the 'two swords and shield' symbol to the Shiv Sena faction led by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde for the Andheri East bypoll. They will be called the 'Balasahebanchi ShivSena'. The EC allotted the name 'Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray)' and the 'flaming torch' symbol to former CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction on Monday.

340.title: Russia adds Meta to its list of 'terrorist and extremist' organisations
340.article_body: Russia's financial monitoring agency, Rosfinmonitoring, has added Facebook and Instagram parent Meta to its list of "terrorist and extremist" organisations, AFP and Russia's Interfax news agency reported. In June, a Russian court rejected an appeal by Meta after it was found guilty of "extremist activity" in the country in March. At the time, Meta's lawyer had denied the allegation.

341.title: Having Big B, Sridevi in 'English...' was like Oh My God moment: Director
341.article_body: 'English Vinglish' director Gauri Shinde revealed that having Amitabh Bachchan and Sridevi in the same film was like an "Oh My God moment" for her. "Who wouldn't jump on an idea like this? Amit Ji was gracious to do this for my film and all the credit goes to R Balki," she added. Amitabh had a cameo in the film.

342.title: 3, including 7-yr-old, killed in road accident in Madhya Pradesh
342.article_body: A couple and their seven-year-old son were killed when an unidentified vehicle hit their motorcycle on a national highway in the Rajgarh district of Madhya Pradesh. The deceased, Kalyan Singh Bairwa (37), Guddi Bai (35) and their son Ankush (7), were returning to their village, police said. All three of them died on the spot.

343.title: BCCI Treasurer Arun Dhumal likely to become IPL Chairman: Report
343.article_body: BCCI Treasurer Arun Dhumal is reportedly to take up the position of the IPL Chairman. According to a report, BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla was interested in succeeding current Chairman Brijesh Patel as he's set to vacate the position when he turns 70 next month. However, Dhumal will likely take up the position while Shukla will continue as BCCI VP.

344.title: Those expecting a lopsided victory are in for a surprise: Tharoor
344.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that those who are expecting a lopsided victory for the "establishment" are in for a surprise when the votes are counted. He said that Congress leaders who haven't supported him because of the fear of upsetting senior leaders have expressed support privately and may eventually vote for him in a secret ballot.

345.title: Who is 'General Armageddon', Russia's new commander of Ukraine war?
345.article_body: Russia's Vladimir Putin has appointed Sergei Surovikin nicknamed 'General Armageddon', known for being 'ruthless', as commander of the Ukraine war. While leading a military expedition in Syria, he reportedly ordered the bombardment that destroyed much of Aleppo. He reportedly ordered a shootout of pro-democracy protesters in Russia and a Colonel under him killed himself after he reprimanded him.

346.title: I'm not comfortable doing TV shows as I'm very lazy: Tripling's Sumeet
346.article_body: 'Tripling' actor Sumeet Vyas said he is not comfortable working in TV shows as he's not very hardworking. "I'm very lazy, they're very hardworking people," he added. Sumeet stated he enjoys working on a web series as long as the character is interesting. "It doesn't matter if it's a film or a show...you're looking for a creative experience," he added.

347.title: Pune reports highest number of swine flu deaths in Maha this year
