347.article_body: About 46 people died due to swine flu in Pune since January 1 this year, a state health department official said. This is the highest number of deaths reported in Maharashtra followed by Kolhapur which has reported 19 deaths so far in 2022. Notably, Maharashtra has reported nearly 3,000 cases of swine flu and 147 deaths so far in 2022.

348.title: Mulayam Singh chose 'larger good' over claim of being PM: Yechury
348.article_body: CPI (M) leader Sitaram Yechury recalled a moment he shared with late Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, saying that the former UP CM chose the "larger good" over a "legitimate claim" of being PM. Yechury talked about an interesting period when the then Congress President Sitaram Kesri withdrew support to the HD Devegowda government in 1997.

349.title: State govt's efforts to stop stubble burning working: Haryana CM
349.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday said the state government's efforts to stop stubble burning are yielding results and just 81 cases have been recorded this season. "Action has been taken against the defaulters," Khattar said. The government has permitted the use and sale of only green crackers to curb pollution ahead of the festive season, he added.

350.title: Kuldeep has got this amazing feature to bowl repetitive lengths: Ashwin
350.article_body: Praising India spinner Kuldeep Yadav, teammate Ravichandran Ashwin said, "He has got this amazing feature to bowl the repetitive lengths that are required to do well in...long format." Ashwin added, "He can land in a particular spot whenever he wants...that's a fantastic quality for a wrist spinner." Kuldeep took four wickets in the third ODI against South Africa.

351.title: 16,000 special buses to be operated for Deepavali to help travellers in TN
351.article_body: Tamil Nadu Transport Minister Sivasankar SS on Monday said the state will be operating 16,888 special buses from October 21 to 23, to cater to travellers in view of the Deepavali festival on October 24. A total of 6,300 regular buses alongside 4,218 special buses would be operated from Chennai to other parts of the state, a release stated.

352.title: Health dept to launch 'KCR nutrition kits' in 9 districts: T'gana minister
352.article_body: Telangana Health Minister T Harish Rao on Monday said the state health department will soon launch 'KCR nutrition kits' in nine districts. The kits are designed to provide a proper diet to pregnant women, especially those suffering from anaemia, Rao said. These kits are expected to help approximately 1.5 lakh women and will be provided during checkups in government hospitals.

353.title: Nissan to sell its Russia business for 1 euro
353.article_body: Japanese automobile manufacturer Nissan will hand over its business in Russia to a state-owned entity for one euro, the company said on Tuesday. Nissan will be taking a loss of around $687 million as it will exit from Russia. The move makes Nissan the latest major company to leave Russia since it sent its troops into Ukraine in February.

354.title: Mulayam Singh touched lives of many in India and beyond: Nepal PM
354.article_body: Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on Tuesday tweeted, "I express my deepest condolences on the passing away of Shri Mulayam Singh Yadav Ji, former CM of Uttar Pradesh and a veteran politician of India." "As an eminent socialist leader, late Yadav touched lives of many in India and beyond," he added. The 82-year-old Samajwadi Party founder passed away on Monday.

355.title: International League T20 trophy unveiled in Dubai, Aryan Khan shares pics
355.article_body: The trophy for the inaugural season of UAE's International League T20 was unveiled in Dubai on Monday. Sharing pictures from the trophy reveal event, Abu Dhabi Knight Riders co-owner Aryan Khan wrote, "What an awesome looking trophy! Had a great evening at the ILT20 trophy reveal event. Wishing @ilt20official and @adkriders a fantastic inaugural season."

356.title: Boman Irani, Satish Shah to join Hirani's 'Dunki' starring SRK: Reports
356.article_body: Boman Irani and Satish Shah will reportedly be sharing screen space with Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dunki', an upcoming film being directed by Rajkumar Hirani. Satish will be seen as a London-based lawyer who fights the cases of illegal Asian immigrants while Boman will play the role of a teacher who gives English-speaking classes to Punjabi youth, as per reports.

357.title: Hyderabad's Gandipet Park opens for public, Minister KTR tweets pics
357.article_body: The Gandipet Park in Hyderabad has been opened to the public as Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated it on Tuesday. The park has an amphitheatre with 1200 seating capacity, an entrance plaza adorned with 12 welcome arches, a flower terrace, picnic zones, walkways, art pavilions, a toilet block and food courts.

358.title: GST e-invoicing must for firms with over â‚¹5 cr turnover from Jan: Report
358.article_body: GST e-invoicing has reportedly been made mandatory for all businesses with annual turnover of over â‚¹5 crore from January 1, 2023. The target is to bring all businesses with turnover of over â‚¹1 crore under this framework by next fiscal year, Economic Times quoted a government official as saying. E-invoicing entails validation of transaction details in a centralised government portal.

359.title: Shah Rukh Khan met 20 fans in Chennai after wrapping Atlee's 'Jawan'
359.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan recently met 20 of his fans in Chennai after wrapping up a schedule of Atlee's 'Jawan'. Sudhir Kothari of the actor's Chennai fan club shared that Shah Rukh booked two rooms at a five-star hotel and took care of their requirements. A collage of SRK's pictures with his fans is being shared widely on social media platforms.

360.title: Indira Gandhi was worried by JP Narayan's agitation: Amit Shah
360.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised the Congress and former PM Indira Gandhi and claimed that she was worried by the agitation led by Jayaprakash Narayan during the Emergency. "The biggest contribution of Jayaprakash Narayan was when he started a massive agitation against corruption and against a government drunk on power that imposed the Emergency in the 70s," said Shah.

361.title: BBMP to construct flyover between Hebbal & Chalukya Circle to relieve congestion
361.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is planning to build a flyover on Bellary Road between Chalukya Circle and Hebbal. The flyover would decongest the stretch connecting the central business area with northern Bengaluru and Kempegowda International Airport, known for traffic snarls for years. "A private agency will be roped in to prepare a comprehensive report," a BBMP official said.

362.title: 3 beat man with sticks after being stopped from blowing horn in Guj
362.article_body: A 19-year-old was allegedly beaten by three people with sticks in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after he raised an objection to unnecessary honking. The incident took place on Sunday when one of the accused was honking continuously near the victim's cafe. The accused, who visited the cafe regularly, returned with two friends and attacked the victim, identified as Mihir Kansara.

363.title: New York City Mayor recreates Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa' step, video surfaces
363.article_body: A video showing New York City Mayor Eric Adams doing Allu Arjun's hand brush signature move from the film 'Pushpa' has surfaced online. The video showed Eric doing the step with actress Anasuya Bharadwaj. Eric attended an event organised by Telugu community in the city where he interacted with the people and also celebrated the festival of Bathukamma with them.

364.title: Guj couple mistook for kidnappers as mute 5-yr-old throws tantrums
364.article_body: A couple in Gujarat's Vadodara was cornered by locals for being kidnappers of their five-year-old child, who was throwing tantrums. When the couple explained to the police that their child was hearing impaired and thus, also mute, the police sought identity proof to resolve the matter. A team of police officials visited their house, said ACP, C Division, Megha Tewar.

365.title: India delivers 13th batch of medical assistance to Afghanistan
365.article_body: India on Tuesday delivered the 13th batch of medical assistance consisting of essential medicines and medical/surgical items to Afghanistan. As per the Ministry of External Affairs, the items were handed over to authorities of the Indira Gandhi Children Hospital in Kabul. Till date, India has supplied almost 45 tonne of medical assistance including 500,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccine to Afghanistan.

366.title: 2 Pakistani fishermen arrested by BSF off Gujarat coast
366.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) has arrested two Pakistani fishermen near the India-Pakistan border off the Kutch district coast in Gujarat. Both the fishermen have been identified as Yasin Sheikh (35) and Mohammad Sheikh (25). According to reports, the Naliya Air Force Station in Kutch noticed the movement of six fishing boats at 11:40 am on Monday.

367.title: UAE President to meet Putin to discuss Ukraine war
367.article_body: The UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan will head to Russia on Tuesday to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin and discuss the latest developments in Ukraine war, UAE's foreign ministry said. The ministry also said that the UAE seeks to achieve positive results for military de-escalation and reach a political settlement to achieve global peace and security.

368.title: Gandhis have made it clear they are neutral: Tharoor ahead of Cong chief poll
368.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said the Gandhis have made it clear that they are staying above the fray and are neutral. He said, "Many electors have been instructed by their leaders to support my rival but may eventually vote for me in a secret ballot." The party's Presidential poll will be held on October 17.

369.title: Mahatma Gandhi museum opens up in Atlantic City
369.article_body: A museum dedicated to the life of Mahatma Gandhi has opened in Atlantic City of the United States of America. It has artefacts and digital display screens that are interactive and visitors will be able to see the life events of him. It is developed in partnership with the Aditya Birla Group by the New Jersey-based Gandhian Society.

370.title: Farmers in Punjab's Kapurthala who burned stubble to lose welfare benefits
370.article_body: Deputy Commissioner of Punjab's Kapurthala, Vishesh Sarangal, on Tuesday said farmers engaged in stubble burning would be put out of the bracket of any government welfare scheme. Such farmers would also not be eligible for passport verification and arms licences, Sarangal said. Punjab government has provided 4,100 machines to manage stubble and distributed 651 machines in current season, he added.

371.title: Can't call it bigger than someone's financial problem: Tahira on her cancer
371.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said that she did have breast cancer but she cannot say her problem is bigger than someone who's having a financial problem or a relationship problem. "Problems aren't bigger or smaller, it all depends upon one's life state. If a person's life state is strong, they can brave any situation," she added.

372.title: 50 overs are just a little bit too long now: Aus' Khawaja on ODIs future
372.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja has said that 50 overs are "a little bit too long now" and the ODIs should be reduced to 40-over a side. "I played Pro40 in England a few years ago when they were playing 40-over cricket. I really enjoyed it," added Khawaja. "T20 cricket is awesome. Test cricket is the pinnacle," he further said.

373.title: Google paid off competitors from making alternate app stores: Epic Games
373.article_body: Epic Games, developer of Fortnite, has accused Google of antitrust practices claiming that the latter paid off competitors and prevented them from developing alternate app stores. "Google spent a billion dollars on secret deals with the top app developers," Epic Games said in a court filing. Google is currently under investigation for its store fees.

374.title: A lot of things being done by Guj for 1st time in country: PM Modi
374.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said when the speed of development is as swift as that in Gujarat, list of works and achievements is so long that it's difficult to count. He launched multiple development works in Ahmedabad today. "As always, there are a lot of things that Gujarat is doing for the first time in the country," he added.

375.title: Belarus says joint troop deployment with Russia is defensive measure
375.article_body: Belarus on Tuesday said the joint deployment of its troops with Russian forces near the Ukrainian border is meant as a defensive measure. "All the activities...are aimed at responding adequately to actions near our borders," the defence ministry stated. Belarus on Monday said the move was in response to what it called a threat from Kyiv and its Western allies.

376.title: FSSAI registration must for foreign food manufacturers selling milk, meat
376.article_body: Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has made it compulsory for foreign food manufacturing facilities to register with it for exporting certain products to India from February 1. Facilities exporting food under five categories: milk and milk products, meat and meat products, including poultry, fish and their products, egg powder, infant food and nutraceuticals must be registered.

377.title: Investors lose â‚¹6 lakh cr as Sensex falls 1,075 points in 3 sessions
377.article_body: Investors lost â‚¹6 lakh crore as Sensex fell 1,075 points in three sessions and market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms came down to â‚¹269.8 lakh crore, provisional exchange data showed. Shares of Reliance Industries Limited, Infosys, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank and Tata Consultancy Services fell the most for both Sensex and Nifty. Stocks of 2,344 firms on Sensex fell on Tuesday.

378.title: Roger Federer's farewell event at Swiss Indoors Basel postponed
378.article_body: Roger Federer's farewell ceremony at Swiss Indoors Basel was postponed after the Swiss said he has been trying to process everything that's happened lately. Federer played his last match in his farewell tournament at Laver Cup last month. "Celebration at home in Basel will have a very special meaning and is now too short for me after London," he added.

379.title: India proposes new group for growth of startups across G-20 nations
379.article_body: India has called for a new engagement group for the growth of startups across G-20 nations and urged the countries to adopt open source and inter-operable platforms such as UPI and Aadhaar to promote inclusive digitisation across the world. DPIIT Secretary Anurag Jain said that knowledge, innovation and sustainability have emerged as the new age drivers of economic growth.

380.title: Automotive Axles gains after Cummins' open offer to buy 26% stake
380.article_body: After Cummins Inc made an open offer to buy up to 26% stake in Automotive Axles, the latter's shares climbed over 5% on Tuesday. The open offer is for the acquisition of 39.29 lakh fully paid-up equity shares at the value of â‚¹1,504.3 apiece. At 1:25 pm, Automotive Axles' stock was trading 3.7% higher at â‚¹2,072 apiece on the BSE.

381.title: I've been given instructions to be ready for finishing role: Samson
381.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson has revealed that he has been asked to be ready to play a finisher's role in white-ball cricket. "I've been given instructions to be ready and do this finishing role since the last year," he stated. Samson has scored 86* and 30* in his two innings in the ongoing ODI series against South Africa so far.

382.title: Jaya, Abhishek Bachchan attend Mulayam Singh's funeral in Saifai
382.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, along with his mother and Samajwadi Party leader Jaya Bachchan, reached UP's Saifai to attend the funeral of Samajwadi Party founder and former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav. People chanted "netaji amar rahein" as a vehicle carried the mortal remains of Mulayam Singh Yadav for his last rites in Saifai.

383.title: Y Combinator-backed Explorex raises $5 million in seed funding
383.article_body: Explorex, backed by Y Combinator, has raised $5 million in its seed funding round led by prominent angel investor Taher Savliwala. Founded in 2020 by Mainak Sarkar and Pritam Khan, Explorex has built an operating system designed to assist restaurant operations and management. Prominent angel investors from Silicon Valley invested in Explorex's pre-seed funding round.

384.title: JSW Cement to invest â‚¹3,200 crore to set up 2 plants in MP and UP
384.article_body: JSW Cement said it will invest over â‚¹3,200 crore to set up two greenfield cement manufacturing facilities with a manufacturing capacity of 5 MTPA. A manufacturing facility will be set up in Madhya Pradesh and a split grinding unit in Uttar Pradesh. On Monday, India Cements announced selling its entire stake in Springway Mining to JSW Cement for â‚¹476.87 crore.

385.title: Ukrainians sing patriotic songs as they shelter from Russian airstrikes
385.article_body: Residents of Kyiv were filmed singing Ukraine's national anthem and patriotic songs in a metro station as they sheltered from Russian airstrikes on Monday. Ukraine's Defence Ministry also shared a video of people singing in the metro station, saying, "Ukraine's spirit is unbreakable." Another video showed children in Kyiv singing the national anthem as they huddled in a bomb shelter.

386.title: 2 Australian regulators launch investigation into Optus data leak
386.article_body: Two Australian regulators have launched an investigation into Optus after data of upto 10 million customers was compromised. The Office of the Australian Information Commissioner said it was looking into whether Optus took reasonable steps to protect customer data. The Australian Communications and Media Authority said it was probing whether Optus met industry obligations in keeping personal data.

387.title: Taiwan, Japan chip stocks fall, $240 bn wiped out from global market value
387.article_body: After the US imposed export curbs on China's access to semiconductor technology, chip-related stocks in Japan, South Korea and Taiwan declined. This led to the wipeout of over $240 billion from the sector's global market value. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company's shares fell more than 8% on Tuesday, while stocks of Samsung Electronics Company and Tokyo Electron Limited also declined.

388.title: 17-year-old boy shot dead after demanding payment for gutkha in Chhattisgarh
388.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was shot dead in Chhattisgarhâ€™s Bilaspur allegedly by two men who refused to pay after taking gutkha from him, a police official said on Monday. "One of the accused shot him in his abdomenâ€¦then fled from the area. The teenage boy was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead," Prakash Kant, Masturi Station House Officer, said.

389.title: Hyd Police seizes â‚¹3.5 cr cash being sent to poll-bound T'gana seat
389.article_body: Unaccounted cash worth â‚¹3.5 crore that was reportedly being sent to Telangana's Munugode assembly seat was seized by the Hyderabad Police on Monday. Six people have been detained in this connection. A police officer said that the cash was meant for distribution ahead of the by-poll slated for November 3.

390.title: Pic shows Shikhar Dhawan's look from his Bollywood debut film 'Double XL'
390.article_body: Huma Qureshi and Sonakshi Sinha's 'Double XL' will mark cricketer Shikhar Dhawan's Bollywood debut. A still from the film, which explores the journey of two plus-size women, shows Shikhar in a black suit, dancing with Huma. Talking about his role, Shikhar said, "When this opportunity came to me and I heard the story, it made a deep impact on me."

391.title: Ukraine reduces electricity exports to Moldova after Russian strikes damage grid
391.article_body: Moldovan Deputy PM Andrei Spinu said that Ukraine has reduced electricity supplies to Moldova by about 30%. On Monday, Ukraine had announced that it was suspending electricity exports to the European Union after Russian missile strikes damaged significant parts of the country's energy grid. "We're in constant contact with Ukraine...European Union and Romania in search of a solution," Spinu added.

392.title: 2 killed, 10 injured as minibus collides with car in Manipur
392.article_body: Two men were killed and 10 others injured after a passenger minibus crashed into a car on National Highway 2 in the Karong area of Manipur's Senapati district on Tuesday. The minibus fell into the Barak river after the collision. The injured victims were taken to a hospital. Two of them were said to be in critical condition.

393.title: Goons thrash student for not touching their feet in Ghaziabad; video surfaces
393.article_body: A video showing two men in Ghaziabad thrashing a student allegedly for not saying 'namaste' and touching their feet every day while going to school has surfaced online. They can be seen intimidating the kid, pulling him by his hair and beating him up mercilessly in the video. The state police have asked Ghaziabad Police to look into the matter.

394.title: China steps up testing in major cities, curbs movement as COVID cases rise
394.article_body: Chinese cities including Shanghai and Shenzhen have ramped up testing as number of COVID-19 infections rise. Authorities reported more than 2,000 new local infections on October 10, the highest since August 20. Shanghai authorities will be conducting mass testing at least twice a week in all 16 districts until November 10. Schools, entertainment venues and tourist spots have been closed.

395.title: We got what we wanted from practice sessions in Aus: Team India coaches
395.article_body: In a video released by BCCI on Twitter, India batting coach Vikram Rathour said they arrived early in Australia because they wanted to get used to the conditions ahead of the T20 WC. "The bounce out here...is totally different," added bowling coach Paras Mhambrey. "We [are] pretty happy...I think we got what we wanted," stated fielding coach T Dilip.

396.title: Unicorn startups in India have almost doubled since 2021: PM Modi
396.article_body: India is one of the world's top startup hubs with number of unicorn startups having almost doubled since 2021, PM Narendra Modi said while addressing the Second United Nations World Geospatial Information Congress. "In India's development journey, two pillars are key- technology and talent," he added. As of September 7, 2022, India has 107 unicorns with a $340.79 billion valuation.

397.title: Great sign: PM as daily domestic air passenger traffic nears pre-COVID level
397.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday termed the number of daily domestic air passengers hitting the four-lakh mark and nearing the pre-COVID-19 level as a "great sign". Appreciating the country's civil aviation sector, PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "Our focus is to further improve connectivity across India, which is important for 'Ease of Living' and economic progress."

398.title: South Africa record their lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket
398.article_body: South Africa were dismissed for 99 runs in 27.1 overs against India in the third ODI in Delhi on Tuesday. It's South Africa's lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket. As many as eight South Africa batters failed to score in double digits. South Africa's previous lowest ODI total against India was 117, registered on September 26, 1999 in Nairobi.

399.title: YouTuber 'Dream', who recently revealed his face, quit his job at Apple to create content
399.article_body: Popular YouTuber 'Dream', who recently revealed his face and identity as 23-year-old Clay from the US, quit his job at Apple and had $20,000 saved when he decided to become a full-time content creator. In 2020, he became YouTube's top "breakout" star. 'Dream', known for streaming Minecraft game, recently met his fans in person for the first time at TwitchCon.

400.title: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' crosses â‚¹400-cr mark worldwide
400.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' has crossed the â‚¹400-crore mark worldwide. As per trade sources, it will do another â‚¹120 crore to take the lifetime gross of the film to over â‚¹500 crore. The film, starring Vikram, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Trisha, was released in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam.
